title: Yew Tutorial: tutorial video API server misconfigured and broken
body:
<!-- Please only include one item in each issue! -->

This is about:
- [ ] A typo 
- [ ] Innaccurate/misleading documentation (e.g. technically incorrect advice)
- [ ] Undocumented code
- [ ] Outdated documentation
- [x] Other (tutorial infrastructure configuration issue)

**Problem**

Modern, safe browsers include mechanisms to enforce the Same-Origin Policy, meaning that any requests by the page to a different domain or port requires additional checking before they can succeed.

In the tutorial section [Fetching data (using external REST API)](https://yew.rs/docs/tutorial#fetching-data-using-external-rest-api), an example is given where the user can fetch a json list of videos from `https://yew.rs/tutorial/data.json`.

Because a user following the tutorial is likely to be accessing a server run on the localhost, requests to yew.rs are cross-origin and browsers may reject to process such a request, as can be seen in Firefox 102.8.0esr (64-bit) (as packaged in debian).

When accessing the tutorial after this point, `Request::get("https://yew.rs/tutorial/data.json")` fails with the error below, as well as the additional error in the console:
```Cross-Origin Request Blocked: The Same Origin Policy disallows reading the remote resource at https://yew.rs/tutorial/data.json. (Reason: CORS header ‘Access-Control-Allow-Origin’ missing). Status code: 200.``` [[Learn More]](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS/Errors/CORSMissingAllowOrigin).

**Details about the solution you'd like** _(Optional)_

The location at `https://yew.rs/tutorial/data.json` should include the `Access-Control-Allow-Origin` header as indicated in the error message above, detailed at [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS/Errors/CORSMissingAllowOrigin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS/Errors/CORSMissingAllowOrigin)

**Additional context** _(Optional)_
<!-- e.g. examples of similar documentation which is of high quality -->

**Questionaire** _(Optional)_
- [x] This error is infrastructural and can only be fixed by the yew.rs team

**Error message in console**
```
panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: JsError(JsError { name: "TypeError", message: "NetworkError when attempting to fetch resource." })', src/main.rs:62:22
```
